title: In an alternate universe, women produce millions of eggs that compete to be fertilized by one sperm. What else is different about this world as a result?

body: I post a lot of these "alternate universe" scenarios. Do you reckon I should make a guild for them?
body_html: I post a lot of these "alternate universe" scenarios. Do you reckon I should make a guild for them?

guild.description:
Ask and answer questions.

Rules:

🤔 Posts must be questions. This is a community dedicated to Q&A discussion, so post titles must be in the form of a question.

⁉️ No loaded questions.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

🥾 Breaking these rules will result in posts being kicked and possibly an exile.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

post.title: In an alternate universe, women produce millions of eggs that compete to be fertilized by one sperm. What else is different about this world as a result?

body:
I may have been too rash. Pseudo-multicellular organisms like sponges would probably develop. 

You have to look at the roots of sexual recombination, horizontal gene transfer. When it happens on a single cellular organism it is by the cell taking in DNA from the medium that may or not be wrapped in a protein shell or phospholipid-bilayer(basically a sexual virus) or one cell injecting material into another through a pilum. Look at the relative sizes. The difference in the size of the genetic material that is taken up compared to the size of the cell that takes it up is greater than difference between a sperm and an egg even with all of the M-cells surrounding the egg to support it. This is because it i very stressful to take up and incorporate foreign genetic material. When you do a transformation (putting foreign DNA into a cell) you probably only get a handful of colonies in your dish each representing one successful transformation. And that;'s usually a single or just a couple of genes. An egg has to take up half of it's genetic material.

The cell accepting the genetic material has to be a good size to support itself through this process. Try to do it the other way around and the first organisms that try to do it in a very inefficient way never get off the ground. Without the ability to spread genes around clonal type reproducing organisms never develop the complexity we see in multi-cellular organisms today.
body_html:
I may have been too rash. Pseudo-multicellular organisms like sponges would probably develop.

You have to look at the roots of sexual recombination, horizontal gene transfer. When it happens on a single cellular organism it is by the cell taking in DNA from the medium that may or not be wrapped in a protein shell or phospholipid-bilayer(basically a sexual virus) or one cell injecting material into another through a pilum. Look at the relative sizes. The difference in the size of the genetic material that is taken up compared to the size of the cell that takes it up is greater than difference between a sperm and an egg even with all of the M-cells surrounding the egg to support it. This is because it i very stressful to take up and incorporate foreign genetic material. When you do a transformation (putting foreign DNA into a cell) you probably only get a handful of colonies in your dish each representing one successful transformation. And that;'s usually a single or just a couple of genes. An egg has to take up half of it's genetic material.

The cell accepting the genetic material has to be a good size to support itself through this process. Try to do it the other way around and the first organisms that try to do it in a very inefficient way never get off the ground. Without the ability to spread genes around clonal type reproducing organisms never develop the complexity we see in multi-cellular organisms today.

post.title: In an alternate universe, women produce millions of eggs that compete to be fertilized by one sperm. What else is different about this world as a result?

author.bio: Stop reading my bio you pervert.

body: Humans no longer have intercourse, instead they reproduce in massive pools where they eject their contributions and fertilization is completely random. They also die after spawning.
body_html: Humans no longer have intercourse, instead they reproduce in massive pools where they eject their contributions and fertilization is completely random. They also die after spawning.
